title: Cancel fingerprint after upgrading
body:
Maybe related with https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2281

Check these steps:

1. Install previous version
2. Enable fingerprint + passcode
3. Upgrade to the current one

Current: After upgrading, fingerprint is asked. Cancel the fingerprint to go to the passcode. Enter the passcode and then, a blue screen appears.

Expected: After upgrading, fingerprint is asked. Cancel the fingerprint to go to the passcode. Enter the passcode and then, wizard appears.


Nexus 5X v8

title: Changes in our Git Branching flow
body:
Considering the following scenario with our current Git branching flow:

![current_branching_flow](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/48621255-3a308700-e9a3-11e8-8674-a734e4a11b46.png)

1. We create branches to work on 2.9.2 features that are eventually merged into `master` branch.
2. Once 2.9.2 development is finished, we create `release_2.9.2` branch. At this point,`master` branch is blocked and if I or other contributors want to keep working on features for 2.10 release and merge them is not possible because we have to wait for merging and tagging `release_2.9.2`(step 3).
3. Once `release_2.9.2` is approved and fully tested, me merged it into master, tag the commit with `oc-android-2.9.2` and make the release public via GitHub and PlayStore. 
4. Merge `master` into `stable`.

This branching flow comes from long time ago and to speed up and not block our development process, including contributions, and according to what [GitFlow](https://es.atlassian.com/git/tutorials/comparing-workflows/gitflow-workflow) defines, I would suggest the next changes: 

![new_branching_flow](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/48621258-3b61b400-e9a3-11e8-83f3-90d48583892d.png)

1. Same as before
2. Once 2.9.2 development is finished, we create `release_2.9.2` branch but `master` is not blocked anymore and we can keep merging features for coming releases because of step 3 changes. 
3. Once `release_2.9.2` is approved and fully tested, me merged it into `stable`, tag the commit `oc-android-2.9.2` and make the release public via GitHub and PlayStore. 
4. Merge `stable` into `master`.

Think this workflow is widely used and fits properly to our case, what are your thoughts about? @felixboehm @PVince81 @michaelstingl @jesmrec

title: Lost authentication with app password
body:
### Actual behaviour
Authentication info lost. App says authentication failed.
Need to login again.

### Expected behaviour
Never lose auth info.
 
### Steps to reproduce
Not reproducible accurately, happened by chance.

Android app is configured to connect using an app password that was manually generated on the server.

Here is what I was doing:
- edited file "pomodoro.md" on Monday 12th November between 11-12 AM CEST, not sure if I was online
- later that day I noticed the conflict and told it to create two files
- the next day I solved the conflict with the desktop client and the mobile app just synced it down
```
x.x.x.x - vincent - [12/Nov/2018:18:28:39 +0100] "DELETE /remote.php/dav/files/vincent/clientsync/work/pomodoro%20(2).md HTTP/1.1" 204 - "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Linux) mirall/2.5
.0"
x.x.x.x - vincent - [12/Nov/2018:19:26:24 +0100] "PROPFIND /remote.php/dav/files/vincent/clientsync/work/pomodoro.md HTTP/1.1" 207 895 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Android) ownCloud-a
ndroid/2.9.1"
x.x.x.x - vincent - [12/Nov/2018:19:26:25 +0100] "GET /remote.php/dav/files/vincent/clientsync/work/pomodoro.md HTTP/1.1" 200 2739 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Android) ownCloud-andro
id/2.9.1"
```
- later on the mobile app told me again about a conflict, not sure why. I simply told it to use the server version (IIRC it was on Wednesday 14th)
- on Wednesday evening around 11 PM I noticed that the Android app was not able to authenticate any more

### Environment data
Android version: 9

Device model: Nokia 6.1 (2018) TA-1043

Stock or customized system: stock

ownCloud app version: 2.9.1

ownCloud server version: 10.0.10

### More information

There are two tokens involved:
- "408c3ef82e3450d5791bd570199c3b1c0d68a5a1459df4fc574f7dc4d90ec001113d254a3d1d807f2251bc2c5d52f1d939a64709bacfdb52b9fac41386502e0d" is the token associated to the app password which I called "nokia-oc" in the server
- "4b72207608f411692af037fe9bc8bb767c59216f495e3ff20e6689055ed3f7c7a05e9a4f37731f3fe1218a850ee31081fdab4fb5ff08c99fe8c96ebed84b4c63" is another mysterious token.

Around the time where the auth seem to have dissapeared, the log looks like this:
```
{"reqId":"0abb7fc5-f3ac-4a27-8d86-db87a261599a","level":0,"time":"2018-11-14T15:07:52+00:00","remoteAddr":"77.190.150.229","user":"--","app":"OC\\User\\Session::checkTokenCredentials","method":"PROPFIND","url":"\/remote.php\/dav\/files\/vincent\/clientsync\/work\/pomodoro.md","message":"checking credentials for token 408c3ef82e3450d5791bd570199c3b1c0d68a5a1459df4fc574f7dc4d90ec001113d254a3d1d807f2251bc2c5d52f1d939a64709bacfdb52b9fac41386502e0d with token id 96027, last check at 1542205654 was more than 5 min ago"}
{"reqId":"0abb7fc5-f3ac-4a27-8d86-db87a261599a","level":0,"time":"2018-11-14T15:07:52+00:00","remoteAddr":"77.190.150.229","user":"--","app":"OC\\Authentication\\Token\\DefaultTokenProvider::updateToken","method":"PROPFIND","url":"\/remote.php\/dav\/files\/vincent\/clientsync\/work\/pomodoro.md","message":"updating token 96027, last check is now 1542208072"}
{"reqId":"0abb7fc5-f3ac-4a27-8d86-db87a261599a","level":0,"time":"2018-11-14T15:07:52+00:00","remoteAddr":"77.190.150.229","user":"--","app":"OC\\Authentication\\Token\\DefaultTokenProvider::updateTokenActivity","method":"PROPFIND","url":"\/remote.php\/dav\/files\/vincent\/clientsync\/work\/pomodoro.md","message":"updating activity of token 96027 to 1542208072"}
{"reqId":"24182fbb-9109-41d9-99d6-b2e60c689c52","level":0,"time":"2018-11-14T15:07:53+00:00","remoteAddr":"77.190.150.229","user":"--","app":"OC\\Authentication\\Token\\DefaultTokenProvider::getToken","method":"PROPFIND","url":"\/remote.php\/dav\/files\/vincent\/clientsync\/work\/pomodoro.md","message":"token 4b72207608f411692af037fe9bc8bb767c59216f495e3ff20e6689055ed3f7c7a05e9a4f37731f3fe1218a850ee31081fdab4fb5ff08c99fe8c96ebed84b4c63 does not exist"}
```

and matching access log entries:
```
x.x.x.x - vincent - [14/Nov/2018:16:07:52 +0100] "PROPFIND /remote.php/dav/files/vincent/clientsync/work/pomodoro.md HTTP/1.1" 207 895 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Android) ownCloud-android/2.9.1"
x.x.x.x - vincent - [14/Nov/2018:16:07:53 +0100] "PROPFIND /remote.php/dav/files/vincent/clientsync/work/pomodoro.md HTTP/1.1" 401 270 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Android) ownCloud-android/2.9.1"
```

It looks like during normal operation, the Android client will use the correct token "nokia-oc" when connecting to the server. We can see that it was able to PROPFIND the "pomodoro.md" file with success.
However, for some strange reason, the above request is followed by another PROPFIND that uses the "mysterious token" instead and receives a 401 error.

The "mysterious token" stopped existing on the server already since October, more than a month ago:
```
{"reqId":"r.=VqbU=DSt9rR2B\/akiPeRk","level":0,"time":"2018-10-19T11:41:50+00:00","remoteAddr":"2.247.253.227","user":"--","app":"OC\\Authentication\\Token\\DefaultTokenProvider::getToken","method":"PROPFIND","url":"\/remote.php\/dav\/files\/vincent\/clientsync\/","message":"token d745719c898742aef10b97962154ad2258285efd9ddb5d42947dec3391d4171b2f1f7554bf73df3a9f959397aa7b2fa816fc5cb618748700490546aa9e9c7468 does not exist"}
```

So to me it looks like the Android client somehow still remembers that old token and here decided to use it again. Due to the 401 failure, it interpreted this as a "total auth failure".

When attempting to repeat the auth, it now continues to use the "mysterious token" instead of "nokia-oc".

I'm not sure whether this is related to the conflict situation or not. Maybe inspect the code paths related to conflict requests and see if it's using the right token. Also not clear why it would switch back to this old token.

Is there a way to inspect the app's internal database to see if this token was still stored somewhere ?
Sadly I now reconfigured the account by entering a new app password, so not sure if there is any info to recover for debugging.

Also, interestingly, now that the app can connect again, it once again tells me about conflicts on the "pomodoro.md" file... there could be another bug there.

@jesmrec

title: Welcome new Android components and architecture
body: Android is getting more mature and modern and it would be great to start using some of the next technologies to make the ownCloud Android app more robust, testable and future-proof: - [Android architecture components](https://developer.android.com/topic/libraries/architecture/) - [Kotlin](https://developer.android.com/kotlin/) Besides, we will modularize the app in different layers #### You can find all the sections below more widely describe in: - Re-Architecting the ownCloud App for Android blogpost => https://owncloud.org/news/re-architecting-the-owncloud-app-for-android/ - oC Conference talk, from 4:49:10 => https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iCWvFj94zAI&t=17817s ## From MVC to MVVM + Android arch components ![3 -New-arch-get-public-shares](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/66752506-dc960a80-ee91-11e9-8ea3-60b6a37cbe23.png) ## **Modularization with layers approach** ![4_-ownCloud-Android-app-modularization](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/66753414-0cdea880-ee94-11e9-9947-7c72a027e1c4.png) - Advantages: - Scalability: several developers working independently in different modules. - Maintainability: gradle can build modules faster since the classes and resources are separated in different modules. CI builds will be accelerated too. - Less tests to run when there's a new change: we need to run the tests in the module affected by that change and anything else that depends on it. We do not need to run all the tests if other modules are not impacted by the changes. - Reduce dependencies => less coupled code. - SWITCH MODULES: if in the future we want an app with a different UI and a different way to handle the information to show, we would just need to replace the :ownCloudApp module. And the same for the rest of modules, if one day we want to handle data differently to the current implementation, replacing the :ownCloudData module should be enough. - Key points: - Domain should not depend on data layer directly, use repository interfaces created in domain layer. - I/0 '19 talk: https://youtu.be/PZBg5DIzNww ## **New error and data handling** - `RemoteOperationResult` object will not longer appear above data layer, the remote datasources will retrieve data or throw new exceptions to upper layers. - These new exceptions will be encapsulated in a `UseCaseResult` object in domain layer. - Datasources should retrieve domain model objects, transforming them from data model objects. Example: Data layer working with `ShareEntity` and transforming it to `Share` before pushing it to upper layers. - ViewModels will handle `UseCaseResult` objects and transform the information contained there in new `UIResult` objects. ### Dependency graph I've found an open source tool called [Apk dependency graph](https://github.com/alexzaitsev/apk-dependency-graph) that could help us to follow the decoupling process. This is how the **dependency graph for the ownCloud Android app** looks like, based on [New arch - capabilities branch](https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2508) (I put it live in https://davigonz.github.io/oCAndroidDependencyGraph/ so everyone can play with it) : ![Screenshot 2019-04-24 at 18 31 14](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/56676690-29590f80-66bf-11e9-9a45-32b18ce15a3a.png) Above we can notice some parts of new architecture (OCShareRepository, OCShareViewModel, OCCapabilityRepository, OCCapabilityViewModel...) along with old code. And below there's an example of a **good architecture with low class coupling**: ![Screenshot 2019-04-24 at 18 33 25](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/56676844-776e1300-66bf-11e9-99f4-709ee75b9901.png) Taking into account [this diagram](https://davigonz.github.io/oCAndroidDependencyGraph/) while working on the new architecture would be great and will allow us to have a higher level vision and complete the whole app transformation process. So we could use this issue as an epic and create possible changes that come to our mind after having a look at the diagram. Note: the diagram is currently hosted as a webpage in https://davigonz.github.io/oCAndroidDependencyGraph/ and it uses [this repo](https://github.com/davigonz/oCAndroidDependencyGraph) but we could move it with the rest of ownCloud repositories and even update the diagram via some kind of script included in bitrise (not sure if is possible, need to be checked) and have it updated with new arch changes. ## Initial tasks - [x] Update Gradle + support for Android Studio 3.2.1: #2327 - [x] Remove Eclipse structure: #2044 - [x] Architecture research: - [x] SOLID https://stackify.com/solid-design-principles/ - [x] Read documentation and try some basic examples with new android components and Kotlin integration. - [ ] Clean up + refactors, keep working on https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2750 or even https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2153 - [x] Define lint policies and coding convention and publish them for community https://kotlinlang.org/docs/reference/coding-conventions.html - [x] Codestyle App PR: https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2447 - [x] CodeStyle Library PR: https://github.com/owncloud/android-library/pull/224 - [x] Kotlin code style - [ ] Automating code review tasks: https://blog.bitrise.io/automating-code-review-tasks-for-multi-module-android-projects - [x] Start implementation, defining different use cases, diagrams and using tests (unit, integration, UI). Have a look at **USE CASES** section. - [ ] Consider using paging to show lots of files. - [x] Use current `RemoteOperationResult` ~~objects or opt for a new exceptions mechanism.~~ CC / @jesmrec @michaelstingl ## Issues to have a look at https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/1447 ## Code enhancements - [ ] Use DownloadManager to perform downloads: https://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/DownloadManager - [ ] Use Android KTX to ease SharedPreferences handling: https://developer.android.com/kotlin/ktx.html - [ ] Use WorkManager to deal with background tasks in an easier way: https://developer.android.com/topic/libraries/architecture/workmanager - [ ] Avoid getting context from `MainApp.Companion` - [ ] Use GSON or Moshi in [library](https://github.com/projectkit/owncloud-android-library/blob/master/src/com/owncloud/android/lib/resources/status/GetRemoteCapabilitiesOperation.java#L137)

title: "Folder doesn't exist anymore" on OwnCloud account with a space
body:
### Actual behaviour
- When I'm logged in to an OwnCloud account with a space in the username, I get the error in Dutch:
"Map /remote.php/dav/files/Folder name/Folder name/ bestaat niet meer". Translated: "Folder /remote.php/dav/files/Folder name/Folder name/ doesn't exist anymore".

We already tried to create a new account without a space, in that case it works. If we create another new account also with a space in it, it also doesn't work.

This doesn't work since 2 days so I expect the issue came with the 2.9.0 update.

It works just fine on the iOS app.

### Expected behaviour
- I should be able to browse files normally.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Create an account with a space in the username, for example "User name".
2. Log in to this account on the OwnCloud Android app.
3. It should now display the error at the bottom of the page.


Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)
- No, I can't create an extra user on this server.

### Environment data
Android version: 7.0

Device model: Samsung Galaxy J5

Stock or customized system: Stock

ownCloud app version: 2.9.1

ownCloud server version: 10.0.10

### Logs
#### Web server error log

title: Document Provider improvements
body:
Stuff to improve in document provider:

- **Account management**: accounts are not hot-refreshed. Adding an account, removing an account, or edit one account only works in case of a device reboot. Check for more details: 

https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2291#issuecomment-434707232

- **Save changes/new files**: right now is only posible to open existing files in oC. Modify these files and save the changes, or create files to be saved in ownCloud would be interesting improvements to get a better integration with 3rd party apps.

title: Warn users to select the correct camera folder (camera uploads)
body:
We have noticed that some users get confused with the "Camera folder" field of camera upload's settings. An incorrect selection in this field makes camera uploads not to work. 

The idea is warning the users to select the correct camera folder (folder in which the camera stores the pics and videos) when the feature is enabled (either pics or videos). An alert should be enough.

Considerations:

- Sometimes the internal and external storage path is the same, so here also we can point to confusion
- Non-skilled users (maybe) do not understand or know how to select it. We should make this process easy for users and this is not trivial.
- If the device default camera app changes, should be changed in the app. Could we detect this change to alert the user?
- The nicest way would be detecting automatically which is the path of the default camera, so the users do not have to select it manually. Does the Android API provide such info?
 
CC @michaelstingl @davigonz

-When browsing a directory of photos, I don't want to have to wait for each photo to be downloaded and stored locally before being able to view them.
-The behavour of video files is to stream them unless given the action to download. Photos should follow similar logic.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1.  Create a folder on a remote server and add photos
2.  Navigate to the folder via the owncloud android app
3.  Have you local storage fill up trying to just view the files in the folder. 


Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)
Yes

### Environment data
Android version: 8.1 Sept 5th patch

Device model: Nexus 6p

Stock or customized system: Stock android

ownCloud app version: 2.8.0

ownCloud server version: 10.0.8

title: Pattern lock asked very often after disabling fingerprint lock
body:
Steps to reproduce

1. Enable pattern lock & fingerprint
2. Close the app and open it again, in order to be asked the fingerprint
3. Enter correct finger to unlock the app
4. Go to Settings and disable fingerprint, keeping pattern lock enabled

title: Please add to 3-bar navigation pane links to "Favorites" and "Shared by link" files.
body:
In continue to Ticket#201808107002029.
### Actual behaviour
- 3-bar menu contains only "All files" and "Uploads" links
### Expected behaviour
- By analogy with web-interface please add links: "Favorites" and "Shared by link"
### Why this should be added
This features are very useful. Especially with such scenarios:
- Very deep directory-subdirectory structure (3 and more subs).

title: String improvements
body:
* Change `ownCloud Android app` to `ownCloud app for Android`

> "Android", or anything confusingly similar to "Android", cannot be used in names of applications or accessory products, including phones, tablets, TVs, speakers, headphones, watches, and other devices. Instead, use "for Android".
    Incorrect: "Android MediaPlayer" or "Ndroid MediaPlayer"
    Correct: "MediaPlayer for Android"

from https://developer.android.com/distribute/marketing-tools/brand-guidelines

* Capitalize `Version 1.2.3`
* Remove commented strings. If you need removed lines of code, git is
your friend ;)
* Remove quotation marks as they aren't shown if unescaped
* Change … to it's unicode representation
* Remove whitespace between … and the previous words
* Remove ellipses on buttons

>  Omit ellipses from menu items or buttons that open a dialog or start a process.

from https://web.archive.org/web/20180103183733/https://material.io/guidelines/style/writing.html

* Use "ok" and "cancel" from the android sdk

title: Login doesn't work
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
After entering all credentials, the screen doesn't proceed to the files view. It simply refreshes the login screen. No message whatsoever.
This behavior applies to my tablet, but on my Smartphone the APP is working as it should.
Also, the login is working with the nextcloud APP on my tablet (with the same owncloud Server).

### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen
 The APP should proceed to the files view.

### Steps to reproduce
1. Start app
2. type in URL, username and pw
3. push login button


Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)

The APP logs into the test server successfully.


### Environment data
Android version:
LineageOS 14.1
Device model: 
Sony xperia Tablet Z
Stock or customized system:
Custom
ownCloud app version:
2.8.0 and previous
ownCloud server version:
10.0.9
### Logs
#### Web server error log

title: Re-shares not shown in Android app UI
body:
### Actual behaviour
Re-shares not shown in Android app UI.

### Expected behaviour
Owner of a share should also see recipients of re-shares, same as in web UI.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. User A shares folder with User B
2. User B shares received folder with User C

Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)
yes

### Server UI

| User A | User B | User C |
|---|---|---|
| ![files_-_owncloud](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/214010/43005844-5480580a-8c34-11e8-966f-b4919a4ce127.png) | ![files_-_owncloud](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/214010/43006035-f13fce96-8c34-11e8-904c-4dc63e00516a.png) | ![files_-_owncloud](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/214010/43006098-1d726a50-8c35-11e8-9ea0-d2ff65cd7f71.png) |

### Android app UI

| User A | User B | User C |
|---|---|---|
| ![screenshot-2018-07-20_16 51 22 29](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/214010/43010811-d24a89ce-8c41-11e8-80de-a5ef79b1303b.png) | ![screenshot-2018-07-20_17 00 07 272](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/214010/43010813-d46f97c6-8c41-11e8-945a-333ff64bf895.png) | ![screenshot-2018-07-20_17 05 32 298](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/214010/43010815-d5f6ff4e-8c41-11e8-89a7-929daf05f3ff.png) |

### Environment data

5.1.0

Google Nexus 5 (simulated)

2.8.0

10.0.9

## Solution

@jnweiger PR for the desktop client: https://github.com/owncloud/client/pull/6665

related: https://github.com/owncloud/enterprise/issues/2505

@davigonz Could you add this to the 2.9.0 ?
